metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20509 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
The print_binder_ref_olocked function in drivers/android/binder.c in theLinux kernel 4.14.90 allows local users to obtain sensitive addressinformation by reading " ref *desc *node" lines in a debugfs file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
